```{r}
source("R/decode_barcode.R")
```

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r, echo=FALSE, results='asis', message=FALSE}
for(col in names(testdata)) {
  cat("\\newpage \n\n #", col, "\n\n")
  nums <- rev(testdata[[col]])
  plotlines(scales::rescale(nums))
  thr <- threshold.amp(nums, threshold=0.5)
  plotbars(thr)
  print(parse.isbn(nums))
  cat("\n\n")
}

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r, message=FALSE}
library(foreach)
results <- foreach(col=names(testdata), .combine=rbind) %do% {
   cbind(data.frame(col=col), parse.isbn(rev(testdata[[col]])))
}
knitr::kable(results)
```
